issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify a Milkable interface with method messageOnMilk() that takes no parameters and returns a String (see UML and Part 2 description). The template's Main (commented example usage) also calls messageOnMilk() with no arguments. However, the solution repository defines Milkable.messageOnMilk(double volume) (and Goat/Seal implement this double-parameter variant). This parameter mismatch between the problem/template and the solution is structural: it changes the interface contract and the way students are expected to implement and call the method, which will cause confusion and prevent straightforward comparison between student implementations (based on the spec/template) and the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the Milkable interface consistent across artifacts. Preferred fixes (choose one to preserve educational intent):

1) Align the solution to the problem/template: change Milkable.messageOnMilk to have no parameters (String messageOnMilk()), and update Goat and Seal to implement messageOnMilk() returning the specified text (e.g., "Goat Buttinsky is milked" or according to the required format "[Animal Type] [name] is milked"). Update any solution code that currently includes volume information.

OR

2) If the intention was to include a volume parameter, update the problem statement/UML and the template Main usage to declare and call messageOnMilk(double volume), and adjust the exercise description and examples to show the volume-based return string. Ensure all artifacts use the same signature.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify a Milkable.messageOnMilk() method with no parameters that should return the string "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (e.g., "Seal Clarabelle is milked"). The solution repository, however, defines Milkable.messageOnMilk(double volume) (a different method signature) and the Seal/Goat implementations return strings including a volume suffix (e.g., "Seal Clarabelle is milked (0.5L)"). The template's commented Main() also calls messageOnMilk() with no arguments. This mismatch (same conceptual operation 'milk the animal' but different method signature and return format) creates a direct mapping problem: students following the problem/UML or the template will implement/expect messageOnMilk() with no parameters, while the provided solution uses messageOnMilk(double), causing confusion and likely failing tests or manual comparisons.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem/UML: change the Milkable interface to declare String messageOnMilk() (no parameters) and update Seal and Goat to implement messageOnMilk() returning exactly "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (e.g., "Seal Clarabelle is milked"). Alternatively (if the volume parameter is desired pedagogically), update the problem statement, UML and template Main() to specify messageOnMilk(double volume) and the expected return format including the volume; but do not mix both variants. Prefer making the solution match the problem/UML to avoid student confusion.
